description: Mirah (formerly Duby), is a Ruby-inspired, statically-typed, lightweight, platform-agnostic language with backends for JVM bytecode, Java source, and more platforms planned. It borrows features from several static and dynamic languages, but with a twist: no runtime dependency on any additional library; everything is done at compile time. This makes Mirah more suitable as a “javac” replacement than any other mainstream JVM language, and will allow Mirah to be used anywhere Java (or its other backends) can be used. I’ll discuss design goals, status, futures, and show examples.
title: Mirah
